modules.description: This module implements a persistent hash table where keys are strings and values are arbitrary types. It supports creating, opening, and closing a database, as well as adding, replacing, removing, and looking up key-value pairs, with iteration and folding over the contents. It is suitable for applications needing durable storage of string-indexed data, such as configuration management or logging systems.

This module implements a persistent hash table that maps arbitrary keys to string values using DBM-style file storage. It supports creating, opening, and closing tables, as well as adding, replacing, removing, and retrieving key-value pairs with strict error handling. Use cases include storing and querying keyed string data across sessions, such as configuration settings or cached results.

This module implements a persistent hash table that maps generic keys to generic values using disk-based storage. It supports operations to open, close, read, write, and iterate over key-value pairs stored in DBM-compatible files. Concrete use cases include maintaining a durable key-value store for configuration data, caching, or state persistence across program restarts.

This module implements a persistent string-keyed, string-valued hash table using disk-based storage. It supports operations for creating, opening, closing, querying, and modifying key-value pairs, including add, replace, remove, and lookup. Use cases include storing and retrieving configuration data, caching strings to disk, or maintaining a durable mapping between string identifiers and string payloads.

This module implements disk-based persistent hash tables using DBM-compatible storage, supporting key-value mappings with varying type specializations. It provides operations to open, read, write, iterate, and manage key-value pairs for different key and value type combinations. Concrete use cases include durable configuration storage, cross-session caching, and persistent state management with typed keys and values.
